channel.title: Chats with James Podcast
channel.description:
Chats with James is a podcast discussing everything that James or his guests are passionate about.
Embedded Systems, the Rust Programming Language, and a variety of other technical topics are the most commonly discussed items.
channel.itunes:author: James Munns
channel.itunes:subtitle: James Munns talks to guests about things they are passionate about
channel.itunes:summary:
Chats with James is a podcast discussing everything that James or his guests are passionate about.
Embedded Systems, the Rust Programming Language, and a variety of other technical topics are the most commonly discussed items.

item.title: 017 - On the Road: RustNL & Oxidize
item.description:
The “On the Road” episode has two parts, covering different Rust conferences in May 2024. The first section is from RustNL in Delft, the Netherlands, where James interviews Laura and Jonathan, some of the organizers of the event, on their history with Rust and the struggles and successes of putting on these conferences.
The second section of this episode comes from the Oxidize Conference 2024, held in Berlin Germany - here James interviews Jonathan Pallant about the nostalgia of classic computers, the theory of embedded systems and the up and down aspects of building computers for fun.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with folks at conferences
item.itunes:summary:
The “On the Road” episode has two parts, covering different Rust conferences in May 2024. The first section is from RustNL in Delft, the Netherlands, where James interviews Laura and Jonathan, some of the organizers of the event, on their history with Rust and the struggles and successes of putting on these conferences.
The second section of this episode comes from the Oxidize Conference 2024, held in Berlin Germany - here James interviews Jonathan Pallant about the nostalgia of classic computers, the theory of embedded systems and the up and down aspects of building computers for fun.

item.title: 016 - Scott Mabin
item.description: James talks with Scott Mabin about how he joined the Espressif team and got involved in embedded Rust, the working culture in chip manufacturing companies and preferences about designing and building mechanical keyboards.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Scott Mabin
item.itunes:summary: James talks with Scott Mabin about how he joined the Espressif team and got involved in embedded Rust, the working culture in chip manufacturing companies and preferences about designing and building mechanical keyboards.

item.title: 015 - Manish Goregaokar
item.description: Another episode is coming from the archives, originally recorded in May 2022 with Manish Goregaokar as the guest- James and Manish touch on many topics, including: internationalization of languages, zero-copy deserialization in Rust, speedrunning video games and Vaccinate CA.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Manish Goregaokar
item.itunes:summary: Another episode is coming from the archives, originally recorded in May 2022 with Manish Goregaokar as the guest- James and Manish touch on many topics, including: internationalization of languages, zero-copy deserialization in Rust, speedrunning video games and Vaccinate CA.

item.title: 014 - Steve Klabnik
item.description: This episode is coming from the archives, originally recorded in May 2022 - James talks with Steve Klabnik from Oxide Computer about knowledge transfer within the Rust community, how learning-by-doing and reading datasheets help you develop, and how limits and regulations are put in place across many different fields.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Steve Klabnik

item.title: 013 - Ryan Summers
item.description: In this episode, James chats with Ryan Summers about the process of developing protocols, the guidelines of working in safety critical systems and embedded engineering.

item.description: In this episode, James chats with Sophia about the intricacies of writing programming languages, what makes designing programs fun, strategies for defining goals, and more.

item.title: 006 - Bryan Cantrill
item.description: James chats with Bryan Cantrill of Oxide Computer to discuss the open source hardware explosion, Oxide's experience with Embedded Rust, the importance of a culture of sharing knowledge, and the joy of fixing hard-to-diagnose systems problems.
item.author: contact@onevariable.com
item.itunes:author: James Munns
item.itunes:subtitle: James chats with Bryan Cantrill of Oxide Computer Company
item.itunes:summary: James chats with Bryan Cantrill of Oxide Computer to discuss the open source hardware explosion, Oxide's experience with Embedded Rust, the importance of a culture of sharing knowledge, and the joy of fixing hard-to-diagnose systems problems.
item.itunes:keywords: programming, technology, engineering, Rust, systems engineering, open source

item.description: James chats with Clifford Heath to discuss the differences between procedural and structural code, using natural language processing to describe software, code generation, and programming education approaches.
